'Cytidine' is a nucleoside molecule that is formed when cytosine is attached to
a ribose ring (also known as a ribofuranose) via a Î²-N 1-glycosidic
bond. Cytidine is a component of RNA.

If cytosine is attached to a deoxyribose ring, it is known as a deoxycytidine.
